attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Nursing
301

Prerequisites: EXERSCI 304 and 205, and consent of instructor for non-majors.

attributes.Title: Pharmacology in Nursing
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Nursing
332
UMass Amherst
This course focuses on pharmacology and nursing therapeutics by presenting a firm theoretical foundation and a practical approach to drug therapy applicable in many settings- the home, the clinic, the extended care facility, the office, the classroom, and the hospital. The course reviews general principles, theories, and facts about drugs and how they are given. Practical information is presented on how the nursing process is integrated with pharmacology, and general principles of action are discussed to facilitate the student's learning in the clinical environment. Specific drug information is discussed in relation to assessment, nursing diagnoses, interventions, client education, and evaluation of safe and effective drug therapy.
Open to School of Nursing majors only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36765

attributes.Title: Special Topics in Health
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Nursing
897A
UMass Amherst

39905

attributes.Title: Intro to Nursing Research
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Nursing
420
UMass Amherst
This course will provide students with the opportunity to reflect on and integrate their learning and experiences in General Education courses and courses specific to the nursing major into real-world experiences in nursing, through the lens of nursing research. Skills, attitudes and knowledge from multiple sources and experiences will be discussed and used as a framework for student reflection.  The aim of this course is to introduce the student to research designs and methods, evidence based practice, critique of published nursing studies, and clinical problems and decision-making issues facing professional nurses today. Students will consider how multiple perspectives influence the design and conduct of nursing research, and how their own perspectives influence their reaction to published research.  Satisfies the Integrative Experience requirement for BS-Nurse students.
Open to School of Nursing majors only.   Open to Nursing Student, Traditional Track only
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66699

This course is open only to Nursing Honors students.   DESCRIPTION:
The theoretical foundations for understanding cultural diversity in health and illness beliefs and behaviors, and selected practical implications of this understanding will be explored. Cultures within the United States are emphasized. Students will engage in participant observation as a methodology for learning and understanding another culture. Students will explore dance as a culturally appropriate form of physical activity.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

438

Theory course focusing on historical, ethical, legal, political, societal and organizational issues to analyze professional nursing roles. The process of change within organizations, communities and health systems will be explored.
Open to School of Nursing majors only.   Kaplan: Management/Professional Issues
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66722

attributes.Title: Practicum
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Nursing
498Y
UMass Amherst
Not available at this time
Open to School of Nursing majors only.
Varies from 1 to 18 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
36766

attributes.Title: Nursing Care of Children:Pract
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Nursing
398F
UMass Amherst
The application of principles of therapeutic and professional communication, teaching-learning, anticipatory guidance, parenting safety, assessment and management of individuals and families, health and illness states, and professional development to affect the health of children, parents, families, and self. Concurrent with NURSING 326. Prerequisite: successful completion of all Level I requirements.
Open to School of Nursing majors only.   Monday 7:00 - 1:00 PM Baystate Medical Pediatrics
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66691
Requisite: The application of principles of therapeutic and professional communication, teaching-learning, anticipatory guidance, parenting safety, assessment and management of individuals and families, health and illness states, and professional development to affect the health of children, parents, families, and self. Concurrent with NURSING 326. Prerequisite: successful completion of all Level I requirements.

attributes.Title: Psych-Mental Health Nrsg:Pract
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Nursing
398G
UMass Amherst
The development of competencies in community-based care of clients in need of psychiatric mental health nursing services with the goal of promoting optimal mental health. Concurrent with NURSING 327. Prerequisite: successful completion of all Level I requirements.
Open to School of Nursing majors only.   Wednesday 6:30A - 1:30PM Providence
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66695
Requisite: The development of competencies in community-based care of clients in need of psychiatric mental health nursing services with the goal of promoting optimal mental health. Concurrent with NURSING 327. Prerequisite: successful completion of all Level I requirements.

attributes.Title: ST-Intrmdte Stat/Health Resrch
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Nursing
797S
UMass Amherst
This course focuses on intermediate statistical techniques frequently used in health sciences research, use of analytic software and database creation and management.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
79149

attributes.Title: Hnrs Indstu In Nursing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Nursing
196ISH
UMass Amherst
Students must apply through CHC PATHS to add this course
Varies from 3 to 6 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66723

attributes.Title: Human Development/Life Cycle
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Nursing
210
UMass Amherst
The study of human growth and development from a lifespan perspective, emphasizing the evolution of the whole individual. Gross and fine motor development, cognitive growth, language development, and social growth at each age level. The interaction of such variables as culture, ethnicity, class, and gender. Major trends and issues with a focus on individual, institutional, contextual, and cultural influences and effects. Open to non-majors.
Open to Nursing and Pre-Nursing students only.   Other students may register with permission of Instructor
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36724

attributes.Title: Emerging Nurs Theory
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Nursing
820
UMass Amherst
A critical analysis of the writings of selected nurse theorists. Includes development and application of criteria for developing theory in nursing science.
Open to Doctoral Nursing students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66715

attributes.Title: ST-Measurement/HealthSciResrch
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Nursing
797R
UMass Amherst
Describe and reflect the broad learning outcomes, concepts, and skills as a result of the course, they are expressed in general terms.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66784

attributes.Title: State Of Discipline
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Nursing
720
UMass Amherst
A critical examination of the current state of knowledge in the discipline. Students analyze, evaluate, and synthesize selected aspects of this knowledge.
This course is open to Doctoral Nursing students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36789

attributes.Title: Writing in Nursing Ethics
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Nursing
317
UMass Amherst
Ethics and the role of the nurse are used as the contexts for the development of writing skills. The techniques of specific types of writing are learned through writing assignments, peer editing and instructor feedback.
Open to School of Nursing majors only.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
39644
36731

attributes.Title: Anatomy and Physiology II
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Kinesiology
272
UMass Amherst
Study of structure and function of the following systems: endocrine, digestive, urinary, respiratory and cardiovascular systems. Integration and regulation of system function from an applied perspective through clinical applications.
Open to Kinesiology, Nutrition, Nursing, and Public Health majors only. KIN 270 w/ C-  Lab sections do not begin until the second week of classes.
This class is reserved for Kinesiology, Nutrition, Public Health and Nursing Majors Only.  If you cannot enroll but want to petition the Instructor for enrollment, please do the following: (1)  go to the Kinesiology Office, 110 Totman Building and pick up a "Course Overide Form"(2) Fill out the form, Attach unofficial transcrpt to the override form and leave them both in the Instructors mailbox, also located  in the 110 Totman
If your request is approved the course will be added to your schedule.
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
66405

attributes.Title: Abnormal Psychology
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Nursing
380
UMass Amherst
Various forms of psychopathology, including anxiety, stress, affective, addictive, developmental, psychosexual, personality, and schizophrenic disorders. The major theoretical perspectives on psychopathology reviewed. Various approaches to treatment.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
34890
36802

attributes.Title: Adv Pathophysiology
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Nursing
615
UMass Amherst
Concepts and theories related to disorders of physiological processes which result in health alterations in the child and the adult. Alterations in normal body functions leading to disease and discomfort of the individual presented within an organizing framework. Clinical inferences from concepts and theories of pathophysiology and pharmacology presented in relation to clinical nursing practice in primary care.
Open to PHD-NURSE students only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
79708

attributes.Title: Honors Thesis
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Nursing
499T
UMass Amherst
Not available at this time
Contact COMCOL
Varies from 3 to 6 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66712

attributes.Title: Faculty Sem First-Year Nursing
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Nursing
150
UMass Amherst
Faculty seminars are used to explore the role of the professional nurse through discussions with nurse leaders, group discussions, critical thinking exercises, values clarifications and self discovery.
Open to students enrolled in the Nurse Maj Kennedy RAP program only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
